item.title: [SOLR-15288] PRS replicas stay ACTIVE after a new node is stopped
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SOLR-15288?focusedCommentId=17312808&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17312808

---- Older description (that refers to a bug when started multiple nodes starting in same dir, SOLR-15305 deals with that issue now —
After a PRS collection is created using a single node cluster, and a new node is added and a replica for that collection is placed on the new node, restarting that new node causes problems with replica states.

Reproduce script:

# Start a fresh ZK on 2181
# docker container prune -f && docker run -it -p 2181:2181 --name=zk1 -h zk1 zookeeper:3.5.6

rm -rf server/logs/*
bin/solr stop -all
rm -rf server/solr/mycoll_shard1_replica_n1/ server/solr/mycoll_shard1_replica_n3/

bin/solr -c -p 9000 -z localhost:2181
curl "http://localhost:9000/solr/admin/collections?action=CREATE&name=mycoll&numShards=1&perReplicaState=true"
bin/solr -c -p 9001 -z localhost:2181
curl "http://localhost:9000/solr/admin/collections?action=ADDREPLICA&collection=mycoll&shard=shard1"
bin/solr stop -p 9001
bin/solr -c -p 9001 -z localhost:2181

Two problems:
1. Now look at the two replicas, both are down.
2. Also, as hitesh.khamesra found out, the second replica stays ACTIVE (not DOWN) after the second node (9001) is stopped.
item.summary: PRS replicas stay ACTIVE after a new node is stopped

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This is a major problem for those who want to adopt PRS, and warrants a 8.8.2 bugfix release. Both noble.paul and I are out on vacation and shall both be back after Holi to tackle this.
Is this safe for a bug fix release? I almost feel like PRS needs to marinate on main before we bother trying to back port all of the stability fixes to it.

After Noble and I banging our heads for some time on this (and observing weird patterns of behaviour from Solr), we figured out the following:

  1. This is problem manifests itself in the dev mode only ("ant server; bin/solr -c -p XXX"). If the nodes are started from different directories (as one would do in production), this error doesn't ensue.
  2. This error is present even without any of the PRS changes. As an example, repeating all the steps above with "perReplicaState=false" results in the same problem.

We had tested the PRS feature using a stress test suite that spun up Solr nodes all from different directories, and hence we never encountered this. The bizzare nature of this problem is such that one of the symptoms is stopping one node causes a DOWNNODE message to be generated from one of the live nodes.

As part of this testing, we added some more unit tests and some more defensive fixes, all of which are useful (but likely not necessary). We can add those tests and fixes here, but deal with the broader (but non-important) issue of fixing the dev testing workflow that results in such problems in a separate JIRA issue.

This is a major problem for those who want to adopt PRS, and warrants a 8.8.2 bugfix release.

Based on our comment above, we're downgrading this to a "Minor" issue. The tests and defensive fixes should still make it to 8.8.2, IMHO. Noble or I will have it up for review shortly (they are in jira/solr15288 branch, but need to be cleaned up of tons of debugging messages before commit). See SOLR-15305

if this is mostly logging and unit tests, then that doesn't sound like it needs to be in a bugfix release and could wait until an 8.9 or 9.0. I have no looked at the code yet, please tag me on the review for 8.9 and we can decide if it's appropriate for 8.8.2 at that point.

Testing further with two different directories instead of single directory, here's a bug we encountered.

Build Solr, create two directories and start ZK:

  1. pkill -9 java; rm -rf firstsolr secondsolr
  2. cd solr; ant package
  3. tar -xf package/solr-8.8.1-SNAPSHOT.tgz; mv solr-8.8.1-SNAPSHOT firstsolr; cp -r firstsolr secondsolr
  4. docker container prune -f && docker run -it -p 2181:2181 --name=zk1 -h zk1 zookeeper:3.5.6

Start first Solr node, create PRS collection, then start second node and add a replica there:

  1. cd firstsolr
  2. bin/solr -c -p 9000 -z localhost:2181
  3. curl "http://localhost:9000/solr/admin/collections?action=CREATE&name=mycoll&numShards=1&perReplicaState=true"
  1. cd ../secondsolr
  2. bin/solr -c -p 9001 -z localhost:2181
  3. curl "http://localhost:9000/solr/admin/collections?action=ADDREPLICA&collection=mycoll&shard=shard1"

Check the PRS znodes:

  1. docker exec -it zk1 /apache-zookeeper-3.5.6-bin/bin/zkCli.sh stat /collections/mycoll/state.json
  2. bin/solr zk ls -r /collections/mycoll/state.json -z localhost:2181

Stop and check PRS znodes:

  1. bin/solr stop -p 9001
  2. docker exec -it zk1 /apache-zookeeper-3.5.6-bin/bin/zkCli.sh stat /collections/mycoll/state.json
  3. bin/solr zk ls -r /collections/mycoll/state.json -z localhost:2181

Bug: The second replica (core_node4) shows up as "A" (active).

Start and check PRS znodes:

  1. bin/solr -c -p 9001 -z localhost:2181
  2. docker exec -it zk1 /apache-zookeeper-3.5.6-bin/bin/zkCli.sh stat /collections/mycoll/state.json
  3. bin/solr zk ls -r /collections/mycoll/state.json -z localhost:2181

This bug is fixed with the attached PR. Since this is a bug that affects regular Solr users (prod), and not just dev testing, I'm upgrading this issue back to Critical, and let us release the fix in a bugfix release.
Opened SOLR-15305 for this dev workflow problem (starting multiple nodes from same directory).

Ishan, I'm getting a reproducible test failure that git bisect claims started with b704dc628c2b949a16df501570fec591376a74fa (also seen on branch_8_8)

ant clean test -Dtestcase=CloudSolrClientTest -Dtests.seed=99D735A100387AC -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.badapples=true -Dtests.locale=sk-SK -Dtests.timezone=Europe/Kiev -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=UTF-8

Can you take a look?

I believe what is happening is that in testPRSRestart when you create a new MiniSolrCloudCluster, SolrCloudTestCase.Builder.configure() will set the global cluster variable to this cluster that you're building.

This means that the cluster doesn't get shut down by the @After methods, and also that when you call things like cluster.getZkClient() in the test body you're calling it on the newly created cluster instead of the other cluster.

Can you take a look?

Oops, sure. Taking a look right away.
